intro: Rinorea jaundensis, commonly known as the yellow rinorea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in humid, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
